objtitle.title: Illustrations to Milton's “Paradise Lost”, The Linnell Set

objdescid.origination: William Blake author, inventor, delineator, colorist
objdescid.compdate: 1822 The date of composition is established by stylistic considerations and by a reference in John Linnell's journal that Blake “began copies from his Drawings from Milton's P.L.” on 9 May 1822. The drawings Blake began to copy were probably those comprising the Butts set of *Paradise Lost* illustrations.

objinfo.framelines: Objects 1 and 2 have single framing lines around all four sides of the designs. The framing lines in Object 3 may have been trimmed away, except where still visible along the top and bottom margins.

provenance.note: Acquired directly from Blake, and probably commissioned, by John Linnell, c. 1822; sold from Linnell's collection, Christie's, 15 March 1918, lots 152 (Object 2, £441 to the dealer Martin), 153 (Object 1, £346.10s. to the dealer Martin), and 154 (Object 3, £399 to Carfax & Co. acting for T. H. Riches). Objects 1 and 2 were acquired by Martin on behalf of the Felton Bequest for presentation to the National Gallery of Victoria in 1920. Object 3 was bequeathed by Riches to the Fitzwilliam Museum in 1935, with a life-interest to his widow; the work was received by the Fitzwilliam in 1950.

desc.objtitle:
Satan Watching the Endearments of Adam and Eve,
Object 1 (Butlin 537.1)

illustration.illusobjdesc: Adam and Eve kiss while embracing in Eden. Both figures are nude, and Adam wears a crown or wreath of flowers on his head. The couple sits on a mound or bed of flowers and leaves; Eve rests on a particularly large leaf. Large plants bearing leaves (laurel, according to Milton's poem) and slender branches bearing twenty rose blossoms rise left and right of the couple and arch over them. Other plants cover the ground below the couple, including several lily-like flowers. Satan flies or hovers on wings above Adam and Eve with his body horizontal. A serpent covered in scales encircles Satan's hips, left leg, and right arm. Satan and the serpent (or his own serpent-self) look at each other, much as Adam and Eve gaze at each other below. On the right of the design, the sun is visible on the horizon above the sea, suggesting sunrise or sunset. Beams of light emanate from the sun. The moon appears near the left border of the design and eight stars appear in the sky and on (or in front of or seen through) Satan's body and wings.

component.illusobjdesc: Adam and Eve kiss while seated on a bed of flowers. Adam is muscular and nude; he faces forward with his head turned to the left in profile as he looks intently at Eve. Adam wears a crown or garland of flowers on his head. He sits with his right leg drawn up and his left leg bent and extended to the right. His left arm is bent and rests at his side; he holds a plant with two lily-like flowers in his left hand. With his right arm, Adam holds or embraces Eve. His right hand holds the back of Eve's head with his fingers slightly spread in her hair. Adam's hair is curly.

Adam and Eve kiss while seated on a bed of flowers. Eve is nude and faces forward with her head turned up and to the right in profile as she looks at Adam. Her hair is long and curly. She appears to lean against Adam with her right leg slightly bent and her left leg extended down and to the left. Her right arm is at her side and she holds a slender stem with a single rose blossom and two small leaves in her right hand. There are slight suggestion of thorns on the stem. With her left arm and hand she embraces or holds Adam; her left hand holds the back of Adam's head.

Adam and Eve rest on a mound or bed of buds and flowers—probably roses—and leaves. Eve rests on a particularly large leaf. Large plants bearing leaves (laurel, according to Milton's text) and twenty rose blossoms on slender branches rise left and right of the couple and arch above them. Other plants cover the ground below the couple, including several lily-like flowers. The setting is Eden.

Satan flies or hovers on wings above Adam and Eve. He is nude with curly hair. Satan's body is horizontal with his legs extended to the left. His left arm is bent and is at his side; he points down towards Adam and Eve with his left hand and extended index finger. His head is turned to the left and he looks towards the serpent whose head he holds with his right hand. Satan's lips are slightly parted with his teeth visible. Satan is encircled by the serpent (or his serpent-self) as though bound.

A serpent covered in scales encircles Satan's hips, left leg, and right arm. The serpent's head faces right in profile and looks at Satan. Their mutual gaze imitates (or parodies) the mutual gaze of Adam and Eve below. The serpent's head is topped with a spiky, flame-like crest and it may be smiling.
On the right of the design, the sun is visible on the horizon above the sea, suggesting sunrise or sunset. Beams of light emanate from the sun.

The moon appears in the upper left of the design. A crescent is illuminated, but we also see the dark part of the moon. A total of eight stars also appear in the sky; several stars are seen through or in front of Satan's wings and legs.
There may be distant hills or mountains below the moon.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ stands on a large leaf facing left. A circular halo of light surrounds his head. His right hand is held above Eve with his palm down and fingers slightly spread; Christ is in the act of forming or creating Eve. Eve hovers above the supine body of Adam. She faces forward with her eyes raised; she may looks toward Christ. Her arms are bent upward with her hands together in prayer. Adam lies supine on a large leaf with his body horizontal. His head is bent back with his eyes closed; he is sleeping or is perhaps in a trance. The ground in Eden is covered in grass and a few small plants with leaves and flowers. An forest of leafy trees extends left and right across the design above Adam. A crescent moon appears above Eve in the dark night sky.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ stands facing left in profile with his left foot visible below the hem of his gown. He has long hair and a beard. His left arm is at his side while his right is raised between the horizontal and 135 degrees. His right hand is held above Eve with the palm down and the fingers slightly spread; Christ is in the act of creating or forming Eve. A circular halo of light surrounds Christ's head; he looks at Eve's face.

Eve hovers or floats to the left of Christ with her legs and feet together. She is nude with long hair. She faces forward with her head turned slightly to the right; her eyes are raised to look at Christ. Eve's arms are bent upward in front of her chest with her hands together (but not quite touching) and the palms held vertically as if in prayer.

Adam lies supine on a large leaf at the bottom of the design. His body is horizontal with his head bent back and his eyes closed; he is sleeping or is perhaps in a trance. He is nude with his genitals exposed. His legs extend together to the right. Adam's arms rest at his side; his left hand rests on the ground with the palm facing up while his right rests with the palm down. His hair is long and curly.

Adam lies on a large leaf at the bottom of the design. Christ stands on a large leaf above Adam's legs. Several small plants bearing leaves or flowers grow below Adam; the flowers below Adam's feet are lily-like. Coloring on the ground also suggests grass. The scene is Eden.
A forest of trees with visible trunks and large leafy tops appears above Adam and extends left and right across the design.
A crescent moon appears above Eve in a dark night sky.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ is crucified upon a cross in the center of the design, raised on a mound or small hill. A halo of radiance surrounds Christ's body; beams of light emanate from Christ. The satanic serpent coils around the base of the cross; its head is nailed to the cross by the same nail that pierces Christ's feet. Death (left) and Sin (right) lay supine at the foot of the cross with their heads down toward the viewer and their arms resting on the ground horizontally. Their eyes are closed; they are dead (that is, vanquished by Christ's sacrifice). Death wears a crown and may be covered by a cloth or drapery. The heads of three dogs, eyes closed and also apparently dead, rest on Sin's torso. The winged angel Michael stands to the left of the cross. He holds a spear in his right hand and wears a crested helmet. His left arm is raised toward Christ with the palm turned out and up. Adam stands to the right of the cross with his left arm bent upward and his hands held together in prayer. He is nude and seen from behind. Eve rests in a small depression in the earth below the cross. She is nude. Her eyes are closed and she is probably sleeping or in a trance. The ground below Eve is covered in grass with small plants directly above Eve's body and left of her head.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ is sacrificed, crucified upon a cross in the center of the design. He is partly nude with a loincloth covering his hips and genitals. He wears a crown of thorns in his long hair. He is bearded and his head is tilted to the right and down, resting on his left shoulder. His eyes are closed. Christ's arms are raised horizontally with his palms down and fingers spread. His legs are together and are crossed at the ankles with his left foot prominent. A halo of radiance surrounds Christ's body; beams of light emanate from Christ and case both radiance and shadows on the rest of the scene.
Christ is crucified upon a (wooden?) cross with three nails in the center of the design.

The satanic serpent coils in a pattern suggestive of a spiral around the base of the cross. The serpent's body is covered in scales and it has a spiky crest on top of its head. Its one visible eye is closed and its head is nailed to the cross by the same nail that pierces Christ's feet; it is likely dead.

Death lies supine and dead (that is, vanquished) below and to the left of the cross. He is seen upside down with his head bent back to face the viewer and his eyes closed. He may be gowned; lines indicating folds in a cloth or other drapery are visible on his chest. Death is bearded and wears a pointed, spiky crown. His right leg is bent and drawn up. His arms rest on the ground in a position horizontal to his body. This posture suggests an upside-down crucifixion.

Sin lies supine and dead (that is, vanquished) below and to the right of the cross. She is seen upside down with her head toward the viewer and her eyes closed. She is nude, and her long hair fans out on the ground below her head. Her arms rest on the ground in a position horizontal to her body. Her right hand rests palm down on the ground to the right of Adam's feet. Her left arm may rest underneath Death's right shoulder and head. This posture suggests an upside-down crucifixion. The heads of three hounds also rest on Sin's torso with their eyes closed. They are apparently also dead. A striated, curved shape appears above Sin's torso; this may represent her lower body in serpent form.

The winged angel Michael stands to the left of the cross. He is bearded and wears a helmet with a crest possibly made of feathers. His hair is long and curly. He appears partly nude and wears a transparent cape or other drapery over his torso, fastened at his right shoulder. He faces forward with his head turned to face to the right; he looks up toward Christ. His left arm is bent upward and he points or gestures toward Christ with his left palm turned out, facing the viewer. His right arm is down at his side and he holds a spear in his right hand. Michael's body is heavily shadowed.

Adam stands below and to the right of the cross. He is nude with curly hair and is seen from behind. His left leg is bent back with the left foot on tiptoe. Adam's left arm is bent upward; his right arm is not visible, but his hands are held together before his chest in prayer. Adam's head is turned up in left profile with his eyes raised as he looks toward Christ. Adam's mouth is open, perhaps in awe.

Eve lies in a small depression in the earth below the cross. She is nude and her long, curly hair spreads out on the ground below her. Eve lies partly on her side; her body is horizontal with her legs extended together to the right. Her torso is twisted upward and rests in a supine position. Her arms are at her sides; her right hand rests on the ground with the palm up while her left palm is down. Her head is tilted up, but her eyes are closed and she is probably sleeping or in a trance.
The ground below the cross is covered with grass and small, leafy plants. Coloring and a few spiky lines indicate vegetation below and to the left of Eve's head.
The cross is raised on a mound or small hill. Eve lies in a depression the earth, oddly suggesting a very small valley, a bed, or a grave.
